intro: Echites lockhartii, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in shades of white or purple. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Echites lockhartii is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
